title: Man who posted selfie with girlfriend's corpse arrested after sickening image goes viral
text:
Man who posted selfie with girlfriend's corpse arrested after sickening image goes viral 12:14, 8 September 2015 Warning - graphic content . A sick selfie of a man posing with his girlfriend's corpse has led to his arrest on suspicion of murder Share Get daily news by email Invalid e-mail Thanks for subscribing! A man has been arrested on suspicion of murder after he allegedly killed his girlfriend and uploaded a picture of himself posing next to her corpse 
A man has been arrested for murder after a sick selfie he snapped with the corpse of his dead girlfriend was spread around Chinese social media . 
The picture was captioned with the phrase "please forgive my selfish love" and went viral on social media site WeChat. 
Police in Wuzhou, a district in southern China, have confirmed the arrest of the suspect, whose last name is Qin. CEN The victim. A man has been arrested on suspicion of murder after he allegedly killed his girlfriend and uploaded a picture of himself posing next to her corpse 
The man's girlfriend - who is identified only as Lin - is alleged to have been killed after a quarrel between the two turned violent. 
But what happened next defies belief. 
Qin apparently snapped a picture of himself next to Lin's dead face and then posted the picture online alongside a previous picture of the couple enjoying each other's company. 
The suspect posing with corpse of his dead girlfriend. 
Thousands of users in China picked up on the image and spread it around the internet. 
Police launched a manhunt following the viral spread of the sick picture and arrested Qin nine hours later. 
The authorities have refused to comment on the circumstances of Lin's death, and whether they have yet recovered the body. Disgusting online craze 
The news echoes a twisted Russian social media craze where people are encouraged to pose for selfies with dead people . 
It is currently being investigated by police. 
'Selfie with the Deceased' even hands out cash prizes for the best picture with a corpse - with £50 recently offered for a pic with the body of a 13-year-old girl killed in a car crash. 
They say the selfie-taker should be smiling because the deceased "has gone to a better place". vk.com 
The community's page is filled with photographs of people posing alongside dead bodies at funeral homes . 
The Russian social media community, which now has some 500 members, caught the attention of law enforcement after its administrator announced a 5,000-ruble cash prize for the best selfie with the body of a 13-year-old Syktyvkar girl killed in a car accident, a police spokesman said. 
The family of the deceased teenager told local media they were afraid mobile phone cameras would start flashing at her funeral. 
"We are working to elucidate the circumstances surrounding these reports and trying to determine whether one individual or a group of people are behind this," Syktyvkar police spokesman Alexander Shidyusov told AFP. vk.com 
Shidyusov said the investigation was still at an early stage and could not elaborate on the legal repercussions the community's administrators could face. 
The profile of the community's main administrator, named as Alfred Polyakov, has been blocked for "suspicious activity". Poll loading …
